DataElement.preferredName: Experimental Entity Allocation Reuse Template Study Activity Status Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur). EXAMPLE(S): randomization, direct assignment based on eligibility criteria, etc. For "escalating dose cohort studies," enroll subjects in successive arms, i.e., one arm is completely filled before any subjects are enrolled in the next arm. In such a trial, allocation depends on which arms have been fully enrolled and which are currently open for enrollment. A coded value specifying the phase in the lifecycle of the activity as part of a global library. EXAMPLE(S): Draft New, Released, Retired Archived

Concepts.definition: Being studied; investigational; derived by experimentation.
An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).
The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
